system.biography:
TitleFFF 410-2 Labourer
Birthday27 Nolus 700
AppearanceAge 19, height 4’ 0”, heavy frame, weight 100 lb, ugly appearance, medium complexion, brown hair, violet eyes
Medical/PsychePox marks, parasites (fleas), dwarfism
Size4
ArmorVery dirty rough cloth tunic and leggings, leather shoes; short bow and dagger.
Other EquipmentBelt pouch
Valuables8d in silver
Notes

Biography

Afflicted with dwarfism, Swey’s life was decided for him the moment he was born. No one ever bothered to consider whether he was intelligent or not, he was a mongrel, the runt of the litter, useful as nothing more than an amusement. The child of slaves, even his own parents could not protect him. He was dragged to the thranaal and made to dance and cavort for his Ivinian master.

Sewy’s situation was made all the more painful because his dwarfism has not affected his mind. He is intelligent and can see and hear everything around him very clearly. At a young age, he always had a sixth sense when something bad was going to happen. Only his iron will kept him alive through the hell that was his childhood.

Opportunity came in the strangest guise. A passing merchant took a fondness to the strange little boy and bought him to amuse his wife. Swey travelled with the merchant’s caravan for several years. Although he was still expected to perform for his mistress, during the day he was left alone. When they reached Melderyn, the merchant boarded a ship for home. There, on the docks, he freed Swey and told him he was a slave no more.

While struggling to survive, Swey found work tending horses for a mercenary company. One day while the unit was escorting a merchant caravan, Swey got an overwhelming feeling of danger as they approached the forest. He warned the captain, who, perplexed by this little man’s insistence, sent scouts ahead. They discovered brigands waiting in ambush. After that, Swey sort of became the unit’s good luck charm. They even taught him to use a short bow. Unfortunately, prescience cannot prevent a lack of contracts and the company broke up.

Lately, Swey has been working for an ostler cleaning stables. He hates it but it puts food in the belly.

Adventure Hooks

Fortune Teller: A PC bumps into Swey. He looks straight at the PC and reveals a clue to something that is about to happen he should have no knowledge of.

New Mascot: The PCs are planning an adventure. Swey shows up and asks to join. He displays unexpected knowledge of what is planned. He will camp out and follow the PCs because they “need him”.

Provide a Distraction: The PCs need a distraction. Swey overhears their discussion and offers his services as a village idiot; he will keep attention focused on him while the PCs do their thing.

Stable Boy: Swey is assigned to take care of the PCs horses by the local ostler. He slowly worms his way into the PCs full time service.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Vol. 1” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/friends-foes-followers-volume-1/), by Kerry Mould, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck and Juha Makkonen, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
